### buildMLocValueMap() {#ab6b86c42097dd294307437291bbc8b2f}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void InstrRefBasedLDV::buildMLocValueMap (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &amp; MF, <a href="/docs/api/structs/livedebugvalues/funcvaluetable">FuncValueTable</a> &amp; MInLocs, <a href="/docs/api/structs/livedebugvalues/funcvaluetable">FuncValueTable</a> &amp; MOutLocs, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; <a href="#abc9d9007b0d77bc0954612b88df15142">MLocTransferMap</a> &gt; &amp; MLocTransfer)</>}>
Solve the machine value location dataflow problem.

Takes as input the transfer functions in <code>MLocTransfer</code>. Writes the output live-in and live-out arrays to the (initialized to zero) multidimensional arrays in <code>MInLocs</code> and <code>MOutLocs</code>. The outer dimension is indexed by block number, the inner by <a href="/docs/api/classes/livedebugvalues/locidx">LocIdx</a>.

</MemberDefinition>

### buildVLocValueMap() {#a59a737b5062cc6b00ced87df09c9a353}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void InstrRefBasedLDV::buildVLocValueMap (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dilocation">DILocation</a> &#42; DILoc, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallset">SmallSet</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/livedebugvalues/#a2ad7532d3e36d429cab7c3ade85c5f77">DebugVariableID</a>, 4 &gt; &amp; VarsWeCareAbout, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallptrsetimpl">SmallPtrSetImpl</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &#42; &gt; &amp; AssignBlocks, <a href="#a4fcc5fc74d98f09bd495e93cec779cbc">LiveInsT</a> &amp; Output, <a href="/docs/api/structs/livedebugvalues/funcvaluetable">FuncValueTable</a> &amp; MOutLocs, <a href="/docs/api/structs/livedebugvalues/funcvaluetable">FuncValueTable</a> &amp; MInLocs, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/livedebugvalues/vloctracker">VLocTracker</a> &gt; &amp; AllTheVLocs)</>}>
Solve the variable value dataflow problem, for a single lexical scope.

Uses the algorithm from the file comment to resolve control flow joins using PHI placement and value propagation. Reads the locations of machine values from the <code>MInLocs</code> and <code>MOutLocs</code> arrays (see buildMLocValueMap) and reads the variable values transfer function from <code>AllTheVlocs</code>. Live-in and Live-out variable values are stored locally, with the live-ins permanently stored to <code>Output</code> once a fixedpoint is reached. <code>VarsWeCareAbout</code> contains a collection of the variables in <code>Scope</code> that we should be tracking. <code>AssignBlocks</code> contains the set of blocks that aren&#39;t in <code>DILoc&#39;s</code> scope, but which do contain DBG&#95;VALUEs, which VarLocBasedImpl tracks locations through.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/livedebugvalues/instrrefbasedimpl-h/#l01426">1426</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/livedebugvalues/instrrefbasedimpl-h">InstrRefBasedImpl.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/livedebugvalues/instrrefbasedimpl-cpp/#l03143">3143</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/livedebugvalues/instrrefbasedimpl-cpp">InstrRefBasedImpl.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

When determining per-block variable values and emitting to DBG&#95;VALUEs, this function explores by lexical scope depth.

Doing so means that per block information can be fully computed before exploration finishes, allowing us to emit it and free data structures earlier than otherwise. It&#39;s also good for locality.

### getBlocksForScope() {#a4ce7b03957b1093525b17050a957f24f}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void InstrRefBasedLDV::getBlocksForScope (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dilocation">DILocation</a> &#42; DILoc, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallptrsetimpl">SmallPtrSetImpl</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &#42; &gt; &amp; Output, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallptrsetimpl">SmallPtrSetImpl</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &#42; &gt; &amp; AssignBlocks)</>}>
Produce a set of blocks that are in the current lexical scope.

This means those blocks that contain instructions &quot;in&quot; the scope, blocks where assignments to variables in scope occur, and artificial blocks that are successors to any of the earlier blocks. See <a href="https://llvm.org/PR48091">https://llvm.org/PR48091</a> for more commentry on what &quot;in scope&quot; means. <code>DILoc</code> A location in the scope that we&#39;re fetching blocks for. <code>Output</code> Set to put in-scope-blocks into. <code>AssignBlocks</code> Blocks known to contain assignments of variables in scope.

### isLocationSpill() {#a706f17a46553480f1ee4ad63e6af83d9}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool InstrRefBasedLDV::isLocationSpill (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr">MachineInstr</a> &amp; MI, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunction">MachineFunction</a> &#42; MF, unsigned &amp; Reg)</>}>
Decide if @MI is a spill instruction and return true if it is.

We use 2 criteria to make this decision:
<ul>
<li>Is this instruction a store to a spill slot?</li>
<li>Is there a register operand that is both used and killed? TODO: Store optimization can fold spills into other stores (including other spills). We do not handle this yet (more than one memory operand).</li>
</ul>

### isRestoreInstruction() {#a07570f4999d0dd6b8eda2e51a0ed12c4}

<MemberDefinition

### mlocJoin() {#ad07b52c00979721f3aef3e806f640fa7}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool InstrRefBasedLDV::mlocJoin (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &amp; MBB, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallptrset">SmallPtrSet</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &#42;, 16 &gt; &amp; Visited, <a href="/docs/api/structs/livedebugvalues/funcvaluetable">FuncValueTable</a> &amp; OutLocs, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/livedebugvalues/#a7697a3c717033a44ba7f9b272c1d5331">ValueTable</a> &amp; InLocs)</>}>
Perform a control flow join (lattice value meet) of the values in machine locations at <code>MBB</code>.

Follows the algorithm described in the file-comment, reading live-outs of predecessors from <code>OutLocs</code>, the current live ins from <code>InLocs</code>, and assigning the newly computed live ins back into <code>InLocs</code>. 
<SectionUser title="Returns">
two bools – the first indicates whether a change was made, the second whether a lattice downgrade occurred. If the latter is true, revisiting this block is necessary.
</SectionUser>

Determine the machine value number referred to by (potentially several) DBG&#95;PHI instructions.

Block duplication and tail folding can duplicate DBG&#95;PHIs, shifting the position where values in registers merge, and forming another mini-ssa problem to solve. <code>Here</code> the position of a DBG&#95;INSTR&#95;REF seeking a machine value number <code>InstrNum</code> Debug instruction number defined by DBG&#95;PHI instructions. 
<SectionUser title="Returns">
The machine value number at position Here, or std::nullopt.
</SectionUser>

### vlocJoin() {#a4674e0625f729563d44ba5cab429ef8a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool InstrRefBasedLDV::vlocJoin (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &amp; MBB, <a href="#abba7c6095e3e9ebb63a516620332773c">LiveIdxT</a> &amp; VLOCOutLocs, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallptrset">SmallPtrSet</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &#42;, 8 &gt; &amp; BlocksToExplore, <a href="/docs/api/classes/livedebugvalues/dbgvalue">DbgValue</a> &amp; LiveIn)</>}>
Attempt to eliminate un-necessary PHIs on entry to a block.

Examines the live-in values coming from predecessors live-outs, and replaces any PHIs already present in this blocks live-ins with a live-through value if the PHI isn&#39;t needed. <code>LiveIn</code> Old live-in value, overwritten with new one if live-in changes. 
<SectionUser title="Returns">
true if any live-ins change value, either from value propagation or PHI elimination.
</SectionUser>
